data: Generate Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 telemetry model-driven configuration for platform inventory + hardware state (FRU inventory entities + operational status). Use gRPC with no TLS. Server 192.0.2.124 port 57500. Use a 2-minute sample interval.

telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group PLATFORM-HW-STATE
  sensor-path telemetry-model-driven-oper:telemetry-model-driven/platform-inventory/fru
  sensor-path telemetry-model-driven-oper:telemetry-model-driven/platform-inventory/hardware-state
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv4
   destination 192.0.2.124
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription SUB-PLATFORM-HW-STATE
  sensor-group-id PLATFORM-HW-STATE sample-interval 120000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !

The candidate config correctly uses gRPC with no TLS, the correct IP address (192.0.2.124), and port (57500), and the encoding is self-describing-gpb as required. The sample interval is set to 120000 ms (2 minutes), which matches the request. However, the sensor paths differ significantly from the expected ones; the candidate uses 'telemetry-model-driven-oper:telemetry-model-driven/platform-inventory/fru' and 'hardware-state', whereas the expectation includes specific Cisco IOS XR operational paths for inventory and platform data. The sensor paths in the candidate are related to platform inventory and hardware state but do not match the expected detailed operational paths, which is a moderate discrepancy. Naming and ordering differences are acceptable. Overall, the candidate meets the hard requirements but has only partial alignment on sensor paths.

Generate Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 telemetry configuration to stream IPv6 Neighbor Discovery host addresses (host-addresses/host-address) and ND interface state. Use gRPC no TLS. Collector 192.0.2.182:57500. Sample every 30 seconds.

telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group ND-HOST-STATE
  sensor-path host-addresses/host-address
  sensor-path nd/interface-state
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv6
   destination 192.0.2.182
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription SUB-ND-HOST-STATE
  sensor-group-id ND-HOST-STATE sample-interval 30000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !

The candidate config correctly uses gRPC no TLS, the correct IP (192.0.2.182), and port (57500), and sets the sample interval to 30000 ms (30 seconds). However, the sensor-paths are generic and do not match the expected detailed IOS XR IPv6 ND operational paths, which are more specific and include the full YANG model prefixes. The destination address-family is set to ipv6 in the candidate, whereas the expectation uses ipv4, which is a minor discrepancy but notable. Overall, the core transport and destination details are correct, but the sensor-paths are not aligned with the expected IOS XR telemetry paths, reducing the score.
